meanings.definition: A person or thing that extirpates or destroys completely.
meanings.sent1: The brave knight was known as the extirpator of evil creatures in the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The pest control company sent an extirpator to get rid of the termite infestation.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to be an extirpator, saving her stuffed animals from the 'monster' under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The storm acted as an extirpator, wiping out all the fragile sandcastles on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire was a relentless extirpator, consuming everything in its path.

meanings.definition: One who exterminates or eradicates something.
meanings.sent1: The farmer hired an extirpator to remove the invasive species from his fields.
meanings.sent2: The government deployed an extirpator to eliminate the disease-carrying mosquitoes.
meanings.sent3: The little boy imagined himself as an extirpator, defeating the imaginary monsters in his room.
meanings.sent4: The new cleaning product was advertised as an extirpator of stubborn stains.
meanings.sent5: The superhero was hailed as the city's extirpator of crime and injustice.

meanings.definition: An individual or entity that removes or eliminates completely.
meanings.sent1: The company hired an extirpator to clear out the old files and documents.
meanings.sent2: The environmental organization acted as an extirpator of pollutants in the river.
meanings.sent3: The robotic vacuum cleaner was jokingly called the extirpator of dust bunnies by the family.
meanings.sent4: The whistleblower was seen as an extirpator of corruption within the organization.
meanings.sent5: The medicine was praised as an extirpator of the virus, bringing hope to many.
